title: 4th of July mishap: Fireworks misfire, veer into crowd injuring many in Utah
content: During Utah's Fourth of July celebration at BYU's LaVell Edwards Stadium, a fireworks malfunction injured up to six spectators, prompting a brief show pause for medical attention. A rocket misfired into the stands during the Stadium of Fire event, causing one serious injury. Event organizers paused the show to aid those hurt and investigated the incident, later resuming after safety checks. Witnesses described the chaotic scene as officials assessed the mishap, ensuring subsequent fireworks were safe.
summary: During Utah's Fourth of July celebration at BYU's LaVell Edwards Stadium, a fireworks malfunction injured up to six spectators, prompting a brief show pause for medical attention. A rocket misfired into the stands during the Stadium of Fire event, causing one serious injury. Event organizers paused the show to aid those hurt and investigated the incident, later resuming after safety checks. Witnesses described the chaotic scene as officials assessed the mishap, ensuring subsequent fireworks were safe.

title: Reformist candidate Masoud Pezeshkian wins Iran's presidential runoff
content: In Iran's presidential runoff election held on Saturday, Masoud Pezeshkian, a reformist candidate and heart surgeon, emerged as the winner. His campaign promises included engaging with Western nations and easing the enforcement of Iran's mandatory headscarf law. These pledges resonated with voters following a challenging period marked by sanctions and protests that have put pressure on the Islamic Republic. Pezeshkian's rival, the hard-liner Saeed Jalili, was unsuccessful in his bid for the presidency.
summary: In Iran's presidential runoff election held on Saturday, Masoud Pezeshkian, a reformist candidate and heart surgeon, emerged as the winner. His campaign promises included engaging with Western nations and easing the enforcement of Iran's mandatory headscarf law. These pledges resonated with voters following a challenging period marked by sanctions and protests that have put pressure on the Islamic Republic. Pezeshkian's rival, the hard-liner Saeed Jalili, was unsuccessful in his bid for the presidency.

title: 'I was sick': Joe Biden looks for excuses in first interview after terrible debate performance
content: "I was sick, I was feeling terrible... We were trying to figure out what's wrong," Biden explained in an excerpt from his first television interview since the debate. "They did a test to see whether or not I had some infection, you know, a virus. I didn't. I just had a really bad cold." As supporters cheered, Biden also attacked his rival, reading from teleprompters. "Let's focus on what really matters," he said.
summary: "I was sick, I was feeling terrible... We were trying to figure out what's wrong," Biden explained in an excerpt from his first television interview since the debate. "They did a test to see whether or not I had some infection, you know, a virus. I didn't. I just had a really bad cold." As supporters cheered, Biden also attacked his rival, reading from teleprompters. "Let's focus on what really matters," he said.

title: Elon Musk argues delay in disclosing Twitter stake was 'unintentional mistake, not fraud'
'I'm Still in Good Shape': Biden rejects calls for independent medical review
content: In a recent interview with ABC's George Stephanopoulos, President Joe Biden, who is 81 years old, addressed questions regarding his age and ability to serve another term in office. He dismissed the suggestion of undergoing an independent medical evaluation, asserting that the demanding nature of his daily responsibilities as president serves as a constant cognitive assessment. Throughout the interview, Biden asserted that his physical condition has not deteriorated since the beginning of his presidency.
summary: In a recent interview with ABC's George Stephanopoulos, President Joe Biden, who is 81 years old, addressed questions regarding his age and ability to serve another term in office. He dismissed the suggestion of undergoing an independent medical evaluation, asserting that the demanding nature of his daily responsibilities as president serves as a constant cognitive assessment. Throughout the interview, Biden asserted that his physical condition has not deteriorated since the beginning of his presidency.

title: Gaza's biggest soccer stadium is now a shelter for thousands of displaced Palestinians
content: Thousands of displaced Palestinians in Gaza's Yarmouk Sports Stadium, fleeing Israel's offensive, face food and water shortages. Families from bombed Shijaiyah live in makeshift tents. Israeli troops isolate the area, U.N. aid meets needs. Hazem Abu Thoraya notes home destruction, Um Bashar bathes a child. Fear grips all ages. Israel blames U.N. for slow aid.
summary: Thousands of displaced Palestinians in Gaza's Yarmouk Sports Stadium, fleeing Israel's offensive, face food and water shortages. Families from bombed Shijaiyah live in makeshift tents. Israeli troops isolate the area, U.N. aid meets needs. Hazem Abu Thoraya notes home destruction, Um Bashar bathes a child. Fear grips all ages. Israel blames U.N. for slow aid.

title: Reformist faces ultraconservative as Iran votes for president
content: Iranians voted Friday in a presidential election runoff between a reformist advocating improved ties with the West and an ultraconservative former nuclear negotiator. The runoff between reformist Masoud Pezeshkian and ultraconservative Saeed Jalili comes amid heightened regional tensions over the Gaza war, Iran's nuclear standoff with the West and widespread economic discontent exacerbated by Western sanctions.
summary: Iranians voted Friday in a presidential election runoff between a reformist advocating improved ties with the West and an ultraconservative former nuclear negotiator. The runoff between reformist Masoud Pezeshkian and ultraconservative Saeed Jalili comes amid heightened regional tensions over the Gaza war, Iran's nuclear standoff with the West and widespread economic discontent exacerbated by Western sanctions.

title: Royal on Wheels: Prince Williams zips into Windsor castle on e-scooter
content: Prince William, spotted riding an electric scooter into Windsor Castle, uses the device to reduce his commute time. Purchased last year, the scooter facilitates travel between his home and the castle. Known for his love of motorcycles, William celebrated his 42nd birthday at a Taylor Swift concert with his children.
summary: Prince William, spotted riding an electric scooter into Windsor Castle, uses the device to reduce his commute time. Purchased last year, the scooter facilitates travel between his home and the castle. Known for his love of motorcycles, William celebrated his 42nd birthday at a Taylor Swift concert with his children.

Fierce fighting breaks out as militias launch new attacks against regime in Myanmar's civil war
content: New fighting in northeastern Myanmar has reignited tensions as powerful militias target regime positions. The military faces pressure from multiple fronts in the civil war. The situation remains fluid as forces clash in Shan state and Mandalay region.
summary: New fighting in northeastern Myanmar has reignited tensions as powerful militias target regime positions. The military faces pressure from multiple fronts in the civil war. The situation remains fluid as forces clash in Shan state and Mandalay region.

title: Karachi faces fuel shortage amid strike of petroleum dealers
World food prices hold firm in June, UN's FAO reports
content: UN FAO's June index remained at 120.6. Vegetable oil climbed 3.1%, boosted by palm, soy, and sunflower oil. Dairy rose 1.2%, sugar 1.9% amid low Brazilian harvests. Cereals fell 3%, with maize increases in Argentina, Brazil. Meat stable. 2024 cereal forecast: 2.854B tons. Index hit three-year low in February post-Ukraine invasion.
summary: UN FAO's June index remained at 120.6. Vegetable oil climbed 3.1%, boosted by palm, soy, and sunflower oil. Dairy rose 1.2%, sugar 1.9% amid low Brazilian harvests. Cereals fell 3%, with maize increases in Argentina, Brazil. Meat stable. 2024 cereal forecast: 2.854B tons. Index hit three-year low in February post-Ukraine invasion.

title: 'Growth oriented' or 'Barbaric'? Greece's 6-day work law sparks row
content: Greece's new six-day workweek allows certain 24-hour industries to pay extra for over 40 hours. Prime Minister Mitsotakis supports this growth initiative despite union and Syriza concerns. Minister Kerameus assures five-day norms stay. Greece, facing long workweeks, poverty, and post-crisis austerity, diverges from Sanders' 32-hour week proposal. The European Central Bank was involved.
summary: Greece's new six-day workweek allows certain 24-hour industries to pay extra for over 40 hours. Prime Minister Mitsotakis supports this growth initiative despite union and Syriza concerns. Minister Kerameus assures five-day norms stay. Greece, facing long workweeks, poverty, and post-crisis austerity, diverges from Sanders' 32-hour week proposal. The European Central Bank was involved.

title: Watch: Florida man uses alligator's teeth to open beer can in viral clip
Scottish independence hit as SNP suffers 'black night' in UK poll
content: Scotland's SNP faced a blow at the UK election, losing to Labour led by Keir Starmer. Stephen Flynn called it a 'black night.' SNP loses key positions including Prime Minister's Questions. Ex-leader Sturgeon, finance scandal; Peter Murrell charged with embezzlement. Labour wins majority in Britain; independence contentious post-2014 referendum, Scottish Greens deal collapses.
summary: Scotland's SNP faced a blow at the UK election, losing to Labour led by Keir Starmer. Stephen Flynn called it a 'black night.' SNP loses key positions including Prime Minister's Questions. Ex-leader Sturgeon, finance scandal; Peter Murrell charged with embezzlement. Labour wins majority in Britain; independence contentious post-2014 referendum, Scottish Greens deal collapses.

title: Record number of UK Cabinet ministers defeated in general election
How Keir Starmer defied expectations to lift Labour back to power
content: Starmer has now led Labour to victory, potentially securing the largest majority in Parliament since Tony Blair’s New Labour landslide in 1997. The presumptive prime minister has significantly exceeded expectations since succeeding the hard-left leader Jeremy Corbyn in 2020. Despite being seen as bland and boring, and not a "Tony Blair," Starmer has partially benefited from favorable circumstances, helping him revive Labour's prospects.
summary: Starmer has now led Labour to victory, potentially securing the largest majority in Parliament since Tony Blair’s New Labour landslide in 1997. The presumptive prime minister has significantly exceeded expectations since succeeding the hard-left leader Jeremy Corbyn in 2020. Despite being seen as bland and boring, and not a "Tony Blair," Starmer has partially benefited from favorable circumstances, helping him revive Labour's prospects.
